title: Kwato Island
text:
Kwato Island an island in China Strait, <a href="Milne%20Bay%20Province">Milne Bay Province</a>, <a href="Papua%20New%20Guinea">Papua New Guinea</a>.
Administration.
The island belongs to Logea North Ward, which belongs to <a href="Bwanabwana%20Rural">Bwanabwana Rural Local Level Government Area</a> <a href="Districts%20and%20LLGs%20of%20Papua%20New%20Guinea">LLG</a>, <a href="Samarai-Murua%20District">Samarai-Murua</a> <a href="Districts%20and%20LLGs%20of%20Papua%20New%20Guinea">District</a>, which are in <a href="Milne%20Bay%20Province">Milne Bay Province</a>.
History.
In 1891, Rev Charles Abel and his wife Beatrice commenced a <a href="Alice%20Wedega">mission</a> on this island, which developed into a non-hierarchical church, and self-supporting mission, teaching boat-building, agriculture and management skills.
Geography.
The island is part of the <a href="Logea%20Island">Logea group</a>, itself a part of <a href="Samarai%20Islands">Samarai Islands</a> of the <a href="Louisiade%20Archipelago">Louisiade Archipelago</a>.
Economy.
The islanders, like other from <a href="Samarai%20Islands">Samarai Islands</a> are experts in boat building.
Demographics.
The population of 66 is split between 2 villages: Kwato missionary which is inland, and Isuhina which is on the coast.
Transportation.
There is a dock on the island.
